Server¶

The Flask code is split into 2 files:

  • server.py – Entry point for the Flask app, handles serving the static files
  • backend.py – Serves endpoints for dynamic data

server.py¶

The server.py file serves the static pages, and expects Vue (on the static pages) to poll the backend for information.

server.index()[source]¶

Serves the welcome page

server.facultyIndex(path)[source]¶

Serves the faculty portal

server.studentIndex(path)[source]¶

Serves the student portal

server.helpIndex(path)[source]¶

Serves the Sphinx documentation

server.add_header(r)[source]¶

Add headers to force the browser to not cache static files. To make it easier for development, can be safely removed in production.

backend.py¶

The backend.py file prepares the data needed and exposes the data to the frontend via REST endpoints.

backend.fetchPrereqs(module_code)[source]¶

Fetches a list of prerequisites for a given module_code.

Uses nusmods’ API. Returns an empty list of module is not found.

Parameters: module_code – string, module code

backend.fetchGoogleSheet(url_num, sheet_name)[source]¶

Reads in the Google spreadsheet, returning it as a Pandas dataframe.

Parameters: url_num: integer, representing which ‘part’ (1 or 2) the sheet belongs to sheet_name: string, name of sheet to pull data from

References https://docs.google.com/document/d/1lWEWGZBM1sSIAHUDIcIhfo9MJQUjao3v52Qp5VRyEZM/

backend.fetchFirebase(url)[source]¶

Reads in a Firebase URL, and returns the data as a Pandas dataframe.

Parameters: url: string, Firebase URL

backend.getScore(x)[source]¶

Returns the numeric grade of a grade.

Returns nan if grade is not found (e.g. S/U)

Parameters: x – string, letter grade

backend.fetchData()[source]¶

Fetch and process all the data that we need.

backend.callFetchData()[source]¶

Endpoint to start fetching data

Called when server is started, or when the Refresh data button is pressed in Faculty side.

backend.fetchDataStatus()[source]¶

Fetches the current status of data fetching (as an integer from 0 to 100)

backend.countsAsDict(df, column_name)[source]¶

Takes in a column, does a value count, and returns a dict

E.g. {'labels': ['A', 'B'], 'counts': [2, 4], 'tokens': ['Token1', 'Token2']}

Parameters:
  • - Pandas dataframe (df) – Dataframe that contains the data to be counted
  • - string (column_name) – Name of the column to be counted
Returns:

A dictionary with keys ‘labels’, ‘counts’, and ‘students’, with each value being a list
Return type:

dict
backend.countsAsLists(df, column_name)[source]¶

Takes in a column, does a value count, returns as nested lists

E.g. [[“A”, 1, [‘Token1’, ‘Token2’]], [“B”, 2, [‘Token3’]]]

Parameters: x - Pandas Series

backend.module_all_terms(module_code)[source]¶

Returns all module_enrolments for a given module_code

backend.module_current_term(module_code)[source]¶

Returns the latest semester’s module_enrolments for a given module_code

backend.module_past_terms(module_code)[source]¶

Returns the previous semesters’ module_enrolments for a given module_code

backend.program_current_term(module_code)[source]¶

Returns the program_enrolment for students currently taking a particular module

backend.program_past_terms(module_code)[source]¶

Returns the program_enrolment for students who previously took the module

backend.mainOverview(module_code)[source]¶

Fetches all relevant details to display on main page for a given module_code

Parameters: module_code - string

backend.moduleDemographics(module_code)[source]¶

Fetches all demographic data to be displayed for a given module_code.

Parameters: module_code - string

backend.getModuleGrades(module_code=None, program_subset=None)[source]¶

Returns grades. Can filter by module_code and/or a list of tokens

Parameters: module_code - optional string, return only grades with this module_code program_subset - optional Pandas DataFrame, return only grades belonging to those who are in this dataframe
